website_summaries.verdict: This award-winning entry into the Zelda series allows you to explore a large open world at your own pace.
pros: Huge open world design that features high quality concept art and scenery
Good game mechanics, and easy to work controls
More than 100 Shrines of Trials to explore
Easy to switch between active quests and destinations
cons: Some found the game lags, with a bad number of frames per second
Some discs received had region restrictions

customer_reviews.title: Best Zelda Game in the series
customer_reviews.text: Best Zelda Game in the series! Amazing concept art for the Zelda franchise, easy to work controls. It is very open to do what you want, and for a dedicated Zelda fan this was my favorite thing about this game. Story isn't long but there is so much to do to help you finish the story right if you are into that. I can not imagine a better uniting story of some of my favorite races and tribes from the previous games. I loved that there was reference to the older games such as music, extras, and obviously characters from past games. This was a very refreshing Legend of Zelda!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: How does a game with cel shading get such horrible frame rate drops
customer_reviews.text: I only have two complaints about this game. The first is the frame rate. How does a game with cel shading get such horrible frame rate drops? The answer: rendering unnecessary particle effects in places that would look just fine without them. The second is that some things are extremely underwhelming. For instance, you can invest tens of thousands of rupees into buying and decorating a house; but it's so far out of the way just to get to, and the only things it has to offer is a free bed and nine weapon mounts (three for each type; melee, bow, and shield).
customer_reviews.author: Koral Woobno

customer_reviews.title: By far the most immersive Zelda experience
customer_reviews.text: I can't say I've played EVERY Zelda game as I never owned a GBC or GBA, but I've been playing ever since the NES days. Link to the Past was my favorite. I loved the N64 games as well. The offerings so far on Wii and Wii U have been fun and innovative, but this is the real deal if you're looking for an awesome Zelda experience. I haven't played video games in a few years, but this game has reignited my passion for nintendo and zelda. You won't be disappointed. It offers plenty for gamers of all skill levels, and some of the challenges take hours alone to solve. I can't wait to finish all 120 shrines!
customer_reviews.author: unclespoon

customer_reviews.title: My favorite Zelda game!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Sure, it has flaws like any other game such as a lackluster story and the Divine Beasts being puzzle boxes instead of real dungeons, but still an excellent addition to the series. Love the open world exploration and the concept of the shrines and am one of those that think breakable weapons was a good thing although Nintendo could have handled the concept better than just a warning your current weapon is about to break. Also was annoyed they pushed the game back to be a Switch launch title at the time because I had already pre-ordered months before that happened. But all that aside excellent game, one well worth owning. 9.5/10
customer_reviews.author: DtheStampede

customer_reviews.title: Legitimately one of the best games Nintendo has ever made
customer_reviews.text: Legitimately one of the best games Nintendo has ever made ... but is it the best? Mostly, BOTW is a masterpiece. The graphics, tone, sense of wonder, emotion, and exploration is intensely gratifying. Is it perfect? No, it has a scope issue (in that there's long periods where nothing of note happens), and disappointing boss fights and lack of classic Zelda gadgets, but it makes up for it with the sense of liberation it gives you as the player. This game does what old school games did all the time ... it puts you into the shoes of the hero, and lets your imagination fill in the blanks.
customer_reviews.author: J Morgenroth

customer_reviews.title: Breath of the Wild is an amazing game. It brings a sort of solitude adventure
customer_reviews.text: Breath of the Wild is an amazing game. It brings a sort of solitude adventure. The world is MASSIVE and I never seem to be bored just aimlessly traversing around this beautiful world. If you want to make the game a bit more difficult before even getting the DLC, turn off all notifications pointing to Shrines and other what nots.. heck turn off that map and try to memorize where everything is.. ... On a side note, this game literally makes me think of the original Legend of Zelda where you wonder and figure things on your own....I love it, I just might want to marry the game...
customer_reviews.author: R. Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Great, immersive Zelda
customer_reviews.text: Awesome game. You can get lost in this world for hours just exploring. Yet Nintendo managed to make it feel not repetitive, the environment, quests, monsters, etc. are very varied, and there's plenty of side-quests to discover and things to do. One negative side perhaps is the tutorial/intro area which you can't leave for a while until you've done some quests, it feels a bit boring and detached from the rest of the game. It's well worth getting over this initial lump tho to get to the "main" world.
customer_reviews.author: madrobby

customer_reviews.title: One of the best Legend of Zelda titles I've ever played
customer_reviews.text: One of the best Legend of Zelda titles I've ever played. Comparing with the switch version, from what I saw, the graphics are slightly better on the Switch, however, it's still so great on the WiiU that you're not going to notice it at all. I still enjoyed the amount of details in the game. It does have a few moments of slow downs and lags here and there, but it doesn't take away from the experience in the game. The game itself is wonderful. An open world where you can explore freely. Do whatever missions and quest you want to do in any order. Tons and Tons of secrets and hidden puzzles and easter eggs to locate.
customer_reviews.author: Kaleem

customer_reviews.title: Great Game - worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I'm normally into games like The Sims and Animal Crossing - but I played the original Zelda games and really liked them. This one is fantastic. The scenery in game is beautiful and gameplay is great. Cooking in it is ok - they could have left that off - reminds me of Monster Hunter. I do hate having to climb (I am afraid of heights IRL and it seems I am in games as well) and the shrines are, at times, a bit too challenging. But, all in all, it's a great game. As long as the Guardians leave me alone. LOL
customer_reviews.author: J. Oge

customer_reviews.title: If you don't have it get it
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to dislike, to date one of the best Zelda games ever, I find myself playing it just because it's so dang cool. so many things to do, open world is great any place you see you can get to, how great is that?. If you've thought about getting it do it you will not regret the decision. have fun.
customer_reviews.author: EJF

customer_reviews.title: amazing combat, TONS of content
customer_reviews.text: What more is there to say about the game. Huge map, amazing combat, TONS of content. A few concerns. 1. There isn't very much enemy variety, mostly bokoblins, lizalfoes, and moblins. 2. The story isn't very great or engaging. I mostly ignored it and did my own thing. 3. The dlc is great, but it should be included with the $60. 4. There is NO WAY to 100% without the Wii u gamepad. 5. There isn't a very reliable way to collect all korok seeds, without having to use or buy a guide. I give the game a solid 9.5/10. The gameplay is sooooo good!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: A Burns

customer_reviews.title: It will consume your life
customer_reviews.text: Much more detailed than older Zelda games. Less cartooney also, almost hyper real - hunt for food, start a fire, combine ingredients for a meal, then you can regain health. It's almost trying to teach people life skills! Haha but it's really great after you get the hang of it, like 10 gameplay hours in. Probably close to 100 now and I believs I'm halfway more or less. Enjoying the updates to this brand
customer_reviews.author: Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Fun game to play for hours
customer_reviews.text: Fun game to play for hours. No memorable dungeons and a overly easy final boss battle left me wanting more. No real sense of progression other than armor making you more durable. This is less a Zelda game and more an open world RPG with Zelda themes.
customer_reviews.author: Webic

customer_reviews.title: BEST GAME EVER!!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far THE best game I have ever played! Graphics are awesome, So much to explore with awesome side quests, some that are really challenging! I hope there will be more Zelda games like this in the near future for the WIiU. UPDATE: SPOILER ALERT! I have noticed that after getting the house and storing the dragonbone shield, it has upped my own shields durability, either having it as current eqiupment or leaving it on the wall in the house, it keeps my shields stronger. Has anyone else noticed this? I wonder if this will work with weapons using dragon bone weapons.
customer_reviews.author: Kiki4kooky

customer_reviews.title: The WiiU's Skyrim
customer_reviews.text: Why would anyone buy the WiiU version of Breath of the Wild and not the Switches? Because this version is very easy to mod! While the mod scene is growing on the Switch, the WiiU's has been in full swing for a few years now. Want to play as Zelda in this Zelda game? Do it! Think Link should be black? Do it! New armor, weapons, and more! Modding the game makes it worth buying a WiiU just for that to be honest.
customer_reviews.author: Rolan

customer_reviews.title: Best Wii U Game!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best Wii U game. Bought the Wii U for this game several years before the game was released, and it was worth it. The game has too much to do, I would say. However, it is a great game. I would give it a 9/10, because after you have completed most of the main quests, it starts to feel dreary. You can start spending hours without accomplishing much, which I hate in a video game. But the first 30 hours of the game were amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, Stuttering world!
customer_reviews.text: This game defines open world. I enjoyed several aspects of this game, with the notable exception of the story. Exploring the world, cooking food, fighting enemies, and exploring the dungeons all were fun experiences. But the story didn't drive me to continue. I got my fill of the game through exploration, but thats what I was looking for. This game was also pushing the limits of playability, at least on the Wii U. The framerate would dip to a low level, so I would recommend holding out for a Switch version, if that's the direction you're going in.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Morris

customer_reviews.title: Very fun and addicting game
customer_reviews.text: My teens were very happy that this was available on Wii u. They have spent alot of time on this game and all love it( 18 yr old,16 yr old, 12 yr old even the 9 & 3 yr olds like it) Seems to work just fine on Wii u( they played it on cousins switch before this purchase). Wish they would stop making so many different systems and/or make all games available for their products.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 5

customer_reviews.title: Glad I still had my Wii U for this one
customer_reviews.text: Once every so often, a truly amazing game comes along. Zelda: Breath of the Wild is a game of epic proportions, an absolute shoe-in for game of the year. For all the flack the Wii U has taken, this is a BEAST of a title as the system wraps up. One of the top 10 games I've ever played, and I've played a lot over the past 30 years. Nintendo probably should have made this a Switch exclusive!!! But thank god they didn't for us remaining Wii U owners. Did I mention that this is a phenomenal game?!? Anyone owning a Wii U or Switch must pick this up immediately!
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Buy now, thank me later
customer_reviews.text: Getting this game as a gift but I have already put my fair share of time into it. As a game fan who isn’t necessarily a Zelda fan, this is a must play that will make you think differently about every other open world game. Please buy this Like stop reading and buy this
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Must Buy No Matter What The Price
customer_reviews.text: This game without a doubt is one of the best games Nintendo has made, with high ratings and much praise and it deserves it! There is a massive amount of things to do in this game, whether it be finding all 900 korok seed or completing side quests and very creative puzzles making you think out of the box. There are many ways to fight, and many weapons which allow you to get creative with your kills. Also, the soundtrack is amazing! The tones from a joyful and inspiration to a dark and lonely is what makes you so immersed in the game! This game is a must buy!
customer_reviews.author: Paresh

customer_reviews.title: Amazing game!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting to buy this game since it first came out, and now I finally have it! I absolutely love this one. I've already beaten it without the DLC, and I plan on playing it from beginning to end once I add the DLC later. I HIGHLY recommend this for anyone who's a Zelda fan, or even someone who hasn't played before. I'm particularly fond of how open everything is and how much there is to do in this world.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Quest

customer_reviews.title: I don't think the game brought anything new.
customer_reviews.text: The game feels barren. High quality barren. I think it needs more randomness out in the open and more options on how to approach combat. The combat system can basically kill you in two hits while you have to land like 7 hits on each enemy. The puzzles are a nice sparse break from wandering around. Don't get me wrong, the game is definitely fun. I wasn't being tortured at any part of the game, but I don't think the game brought anything new to the series.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Bought Wii U version....Swtch is too expensive
customer_reviews.text: I know people are picky when it comes to Graphics with this game between the Switch and the Wii U. Dont worry i am here to ease the anxiety of the game not being great on the Wii U. To be honest, the switch is a nice platform and better quality graphics wise. But if your like me and want to save money i recommend just buying the game/DLC. I personally think it works just fine and i havent witnessed any frame rate drops at all. It's still a great experience no matter what the graphics :)
customer_reviews.author: Tae

customer_reviews.title: Love the game but it didn’t last.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game and by far my favorite. Sadly it only lasted about 6 months before it read disk error and won’t play on any system. It was too late to return and exspensive to fix so I purchased another one from Walmart and have had no issues so far. Disk was in great condition and still has no scratches-probably just a bad disk.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This game is addicting
customer_reviews.text: First, the seller was great and everything arrived just as it should. The game is fabulous. I played the original Zelda for Super Nintendo when it came out, and I love this new version even more. It has a cute story. I love that I can go anywhere when I play. I have beaten the game several times over and am STILL finding things I never found in previous times. I like that while you can follow the story just as they say, you can also explore and do things differently. It makes the game great fun! I just wish there were more like this one!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ahlbrand

customer_reviews.title: if you are familiar with past zelda games the dungeon and new item/skill achievement is done in a completely different manner that takes out one of the best lure of zelda games
customer_reviews.text: The service and delivery was quick! The game is a masterpiece laid out with a free to traverse world. My issue is, if you are familiar with past zelda games the dungeon and new item/skill achievement is done in a completely different manner that takes out one of the best lure of zelda games. That and the creatures get redundant quicker than in other games. If this game mixes both of these together i would believe it would hit the 10/10
customer_reviews.author: Phillip

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful game that covers all bases in terms of exploration.
customer_reviews.text: The Overworld is a little overwhelming and I'm going to have to get used to it I'm used to the typical dungeon Zelda crawl. and the world is so large I often find myself losing track of my quest to go out and find different things. The cooking is kind of irritating. Other than that you can go around challenging powerful monsters to a one-on-one fight you can do mounted combat you can just explore you can gather resources. My favorite thing to do is smashing Guardians lol
customer_reviews.author: kevin clyde

customer_reviews.title: Easily my favorite Wii U game
customer_reviews.text: Simply put, Breath of the Wild is an amazing game no matter what system it is on. It was made for the Wii U and, despite having some Gamepad-specific features ripped out of it to make it "the same" as the Switch version, takes full advantage of the console. It is beautiful, plays really well, and I keep coming back to it just about every week since release day. The final boss is a little underwhelming, but the world building, music, and boatload of content makes up for it. (Besides, modding for this game has really taken off, so any remaining issues are being dealt with by the community.)
customer_reviews.author: Steven Windsor

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: I am at a loss for words at the quality of this game! Well ok, not exactly, I still have these words. It is awesome, ridiculously good, unbelievable. If you allergic to awesome or cell shaded art styles, then stay away, otherwise you will like it! Graphics:10 (the best on the wiiu) sound:7 (little music, but realistic sound effects) Gameplay:9 (may confuse some, but it is great) overall:10 I love and I don't care what the world says, I hope you love it too!
customer_reviews.author: 7Jenn3

customer_reviews.title: Great Game
customer_reviews.text: This a very good game. even if you are not Zelda fan, this game is still a lot of fun. It is a very well made open world game, that does not feel tedious, and is beautiful to look at.
customer_reviews.author: Pank

customer_reviews.title: If my son is happy, I'm happy.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son's birthday, and he's thrilled with it. I don't know anything about games, so I can't speak to that part of it. But I will say that it arrived very quickly, in a good, padding-protected package. So I'm satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: S. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: After years of waiting, Nintendo does not disappoint!
customer_reviews.text: This game is an excellent addition to TLoZ franchise and completely pushes the boundaries of expectations for a Zelda title. I have had this game since release day and still haven't beaten the final boss yet - there are so many sidequests and other things to do! There is no wrong way to play - there are tons of options for all play styles. I purchased the Wii U version since I'm waiting for the new Mario title to be released before buying a Switch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: I have been a Zelda junkie forever and my favorite one will always be Ocarina of Time. However, this game comes in close second (alongside Skyward Sword). It is beautiful. The slandscapes are stunning and realistic. I am torn on whether I like the way it flows - almost to where you are not sure progress is being made - very much like real life. I also dislike the sense of so much feeling unfamiliar. But that is just me because I am used to the old games.
customer_reviews.author: Deliriart

customer_reviews.title: My son has played this for 5 months. I'M HAPPY, HE'S HAPPY! Normally I'm spending $45 every 2 months... NOT THIS TIME! :)))
customer_reviews.text: My son has had this game now for 5 months AND IS STILL PLAYING IT! HE LOVES IT! He's about 13 and comes in and gives us updates on his latest battle! He's actually playing it through a 2nd time to win ALL the trophies and get a better outcome? I don't know how it works, just know it's kept him occupied (when not at his extra-curricular activities, outside or reading) for 5 months! for ONE GAME! Normally I'm spending $45 every 2 months! Not THIS TIME!!!
customer_reviews.author: Maness

customer_reviews.title: A Beautiful World, no matter what version you have.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I really love the open world of this game, the main story, if you know what you're doing, can be finished in 7hrs roughly, but the world is huge and you can be lost for hours just exploring different places, it's really nice and relaxing (until you get attacked by a merchant in disguise or an enemy that you didn't notice that was there) No matter what version of the game you have (WiiU/Switch) its a masterpiece to me, sure it'll have its flaws, but what game doesn't? I'd recommend buying the DLC for this, its 20$ but its worth it in my opinion
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Best Zelda game yet!
customer_reviews.text: Incredible game! I loved Ocarina of Time, and tried to love Majora's Mask and Windwaker, but they never thrilled me like Ocarina did. I love that Breath of the Wild takes place in the same land as Ocarina of Time, only 50x (estimated) bigger! This is the first open world game I've played and I love the challenges and the ability to run and climb and swim wherever I want to. Plus there is so much to do and see in this game I feel like I could play it for the next 5 years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Journey Continues...
customer_reviews.text: Hyrule has fallen.... One Hundred years ago an evil Entity called Calamity Ganon devastated the Kingdom and Killed Link the Chosen protector of Zelda the Princess. Placed in a rejuvenation chamber Link awakes with Amnesia and is thrust headlong into a fight to reclaim the Kingdom. Featuring a vast open world and voiced cutscenes Breath of the Wild radically shifts the tried and true Zelda paradigm in glorious ways.
customer_reviews.author: Otis H. McNutt

customer_reviews.title: Play this game!
customer_reviews.text: It’s great. I bought this version of the game since I wanted to wait on picking up a Switch and don’t regret it. It still looks fantastic. Get it for Switch if you have one, obviously, but you won’t be missing out if you play this Wii U version.
customer_reviews.author: Janelle Larson

customer_reviews.title: Best of the Series
customer_reviews.text: I have played Zelda since my son was old enough to play it. He may not have been hooked on the series, but I sure was. I rate this the absolute BEST of the series. I received it the day it was released, and actually over a month later, I am still playing it. I could have finished off the Big Guy by now, but there are so many side adventures to work on, that I am stalling on ending the play. Then, like always, I will most likely play it all over again. :)
customer_reviews.author: BeretDude

customer_reviews.title: Best. Zelda. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: Truly difficult without becoming tedious or punishing. Truly astonishing in scale, scope, detail, and design. Beautiful, subtle soundtrack. Intuitive but nuanced combat that is challenging. Doesn't hold your hand and you'll be glad for it. Weapons break with frustrating frequency. You can climb or swim across almost any obstacle, that is if you don't run out of stamina first. Just play it! But keep an eye on the clock, you've got school/work in the morning... ;)
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Gardner

customer_reviews.title: It ruled all their waking thoughts.
customer_reviews.text: My boys love this game. Just be aware that your kids will want to do nothing but play this game all the time. It will rule all there waking thoughts and maybe the unconscious thoughts as well. I have two boys old enough to play this game and i thought i was going to need to get a second console and game. Finally we worked out a schedule for them to have fee time at opposite times.
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: This one is getting GOTY for sure.
customer_reviews.text: How do you comment on such a beautiful masterpiece? Besides being hard at times, this game is absolutely wonderful. It controls smoothly, Hyrule has never looked better or more colorful, the environments are amazing, the boss battles are actually challenging and don't just rely on "find dungeon item, use it to expose boss and repeat" My only complaints are the voice acting is a little off sometimes and the story is a bit lacking. Beautiful done, though. GOTY awards are in store for this one.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: You can ride random horses, And hunt! SO fun, But way too hard for a newby!
customer_reviews.text: I would give this a five, But it's so hard! I mean, I would love this if it had a difficulty setting, Because I die in this game every five seconds! But than again, The story is awesome, And so I'm not unhappy at all with how they did it. You can hunt animals, And cook! It's so fun!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Lee

customer_reviews.title: Purchased as a Gift
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this game as a gift for my grandchildren and they love it. I own it for the Switch and I love it. It is a great game that the whole family can play and enjoy, IMO. Hours and hours of open world exploration, creative puzzles and dungeons. Lots of things to collect, horses to tame, monsters to fight, and an amazing musical score. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Hackman

customer_reviews.title: Very enjoyable play and kid friendly.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best game I’ve played in a long time. I am an original NES owner so have played a few of the older games but nothing recently until this. This is a thinking game, although battle and exploring is a significant part of it as well. especially climbing. enhance your stamina wheel early and you will enjoy it more.
customer_reviews.author: eagle364

customer_reviews.title: fun game, worth a play
customer_reviews.text: Great game, it got me through a veryyyyyy boring post shoulder surgery time when i could only move the fingers of my right hand and not the arm at all for 6 weeks. If I had some beefs though, I wish there were many more quests and less wandering though the wilderness for shrines. Also having weapons be consumable just doesn't make sense to me. Overall I really enjoyed playing though, and I'm glad I got it in the end :)
customer_reviews.author: Lizardcandy

customer_reviews.title: Great value! Amazing game
customer_reviews.text: Great value! Amazing game. I'm approaching probably 60 or more hours, and I've still barely been through half of the game's vast territory. There's a lot to explore & a lot of challenging puzzles (you actually have to think to solve some of these. Unless you're lazy and just google everytime you need help). Some of the monsters will whoop you or you'll blow through all your resources trying to beat them if you don't possess strong enough gear.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Niedetzki

customer_reviews.title: Enjoyable
customer_reviews.text: Husband is enjoying it, the graphics and scenery are beautiful! The game is somewhat different than previous Zelda games which was slightly disappointing, they have changed some aspects that Zelda fans might find annoying such as the weapons break constantly and you cannot buy more they need to be found. In general this is a great game just don't expect it to be classic Zelda.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine R.

customer_reviews.title: This game is amazing. I loved it
customer_reviews.text: This game is amazing. I loved it. This made my list of favorite games. On that list is Xenoblade and Xenoblade chronicles X, final fantasy 15 and 7 as well as fantasy life(the story of fantasy life was boring, but the gameplay was so fun.) Most reviews have probably gone over how the game is played. Even though I beat the game and know I have gotten all the cut scenes I want to play it again just because it was so much fun.
customer_reviews.author: J. Martin

customer_reviews.title: What a great game
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my favorite games. It looks beautiful on the Wii U, which is crazy considering how outdated the hardware is at this point. It allows a level of freedom unprecedented in a 3D Zelda game, and encourages a sense of exploration that reminds me of being a kid again. You can always be confident of quality when buying a Zelda game, but this really raises the bar. I really couldn't recommend this game more.
customer_reviews.author: ledi51

customer_reviews.title: Zelda Obsessed children love it!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter bought this with her birthday gift cards. In August. It's October and she still plays it every chance she gets (or rather I give her electronic time). I'm glad that I don't have to worry about the content in it as well. I do wish it wasn't a one player game so that my son could get a chance to play with her on the Wii U. Instead the poor kid just gets to watch.
customer_reviews.author: MCS

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Amazon really messed up my purchase and I never received it, so 0 stars for that. I ended up buying from GameStop. As for the game itself, it's fantastic for an open world Zelda RPG but we really disliked the ending. It was pretty dull and leaves a lot to be desired, so hopefully the future DLC will give us a better story. (Doubtful though)
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Best video game ever.
customer_reviews.text: If you're a fan of Zelda games, this is the best one. I literally spent over 200 hrs in a few months on this game, and I still have a few things left to do. It's absolutely incredible! Every zelda game in the past is a precursor to this game, the pinnacle of the series. It both honors all the games to come before it, and completely reinvents itself. My only complaint is that you can't fish with a fishing pole.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: MUST HAVE ZELDA GAME!
customer_reviews.text: A definite must have for the Wii U library. Was worth all the money and with the DLC it is even better. Reccomend getting an external hard drive before purchasing DLC thoughReccomend this one. Again great game. Full of zelda references. Loads of fun. Hard to put down. Need I say more? I shared and loaned it to a friend and I had to give him a copy as a gift just so he can keep playing and I can get mine back without any regrets! ^_^
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ja Lasko

customer_reviews.title: Kept husband busy for 5 months
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase. Kept my husband busy for 5 months so I could get some work done at home. Amusing to watch him get frustrated every so often. Seems challenging. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Grace Lan

customer_reviews.title: ... with an age range of 4-31 that is an amazing feat. It also encourages a long lost sense ...
customer_reviews.text: My whole family enjoys this game with an age range of 4-31 that is an amazing feat. It also encourages a long lost sense of coop in a single player game. My experience and solutions to problems have been different than the rest of the families. I may fight a boss head first, my wife will explore and find something to give her an edge, my son might use the surrounding area to beat the boss with ease. Each experience different but they achieved the same result. Great game.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina Cronauer

customer_reviews.title: Best game I've played in years
customer_reviews.text: Best game I've played in years. Has some technical issues, but "best" doesn't mean "perfect" and for me hasn't been anything that takes away from the great gaming experience. Weapons and shields break easily but they add to the survival aspect of the game. Shrines are short but engaging and always provide a reward for leveling up, unlike other open world games where you spend up to an hour exploring a crypt or fort only to come up with a few items you could have bought in town and saved all that time. None of the quests, tasks or random explorations I've done have felt like a waste of time. Easily a world you can get lost in for hours.
customer_reviews.author: James Galeano

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!! ^ω^
customer_reviews.text: Breath of the Wild is really worth it and it's so Awesome!! You're going to do so many new things that you won't ever get bored, and exploring everything doesn't get boring either. They have treasure in many places and you get to find the korok in places you didn't think they'd have anything at. It's fun, and I'm so addicted to the game! I love playing it. ^ω^ I'm a huge Legend of Zelda fan, and Link has been my favorite character ever since I was a child, that playing a game like this is very exciting for me, especially since I have always loved exploring in the other previous games :3
customer_reviews.author: Lightnesslove

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to the Zelda Universe
customer_reviews.text: The gameplay is phenomenal! I play for hours and hours just exploring the over world! The real downside of the game is that (in my opinion) the story is very lacking and cliche in comparison to other storylines in the series... But the gameplay more than makes up for it. I also dislike that there aren't any "real" dungeons. The shrines are a far cry from typical Zelda dungeons which I greatly miss...
customer_reviews.author: J Riddle

customer_reviews.title: Zelda, Hyrule!
customer_reviews.text: You wake up, and find everything has gone to put in your absence... Open world. Cooking is important as is wearing and upgrading your armor. Weapons ARE Disposable! Upgrade your stasis skill! Bring your horse to a stable! And above all... Enjoy! P.S. shield surfing is for snow.... Shield + jump + A? Shoot the eye. Bash the machine!
customer_reviews.author: Joelseph Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Great game, fast delivery, perfect quality
customer_reviews.text: After hearing so much about this game, I finally bit the bullet and bought a copy for the Wii U. I'm blown away...I'm playing exclusively on the Wii U Gamepad, and it's just great. Sometimes there are frame-rate hiccups, but apparently that is the same case with the Switch version as well. All in all, a great game to play, especially on the gamepad. Addicting!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing game
customer_reviews.text: Love this game. I have spent hours and hours wandering the scenic worlds. This was my first Zelda game but will not be my last. Even after completing the main goal of the game I have spent hours finding more hidden gems. I am not your typical gamer since I am a 55 year old female but I became totally immersed in this.
customer_reviews.author: Lifeski

customer_reviews.title: A Zelda fan must have.
customer_reviews.text: My 55 year old 8bit Zelda loving husband and my 22 year old son are crazy about this game. The music, the duku tree, beadle, there is a reference from every past game to make you feel connected. The game is visually amazing, just beautiful. We got it for ps4 and since the patch frame rate glitches are gone. Very open world feel, even after beating Ganons there is more to explore.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn L. Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Best game I've ever played
customer_reviews.text: This may be the best video game I've ever played. I'm of the original NES generation and played the first zelda... At first I thought playing this would be nothing more than a trip down memory lane, but I quickly realized it's original and all-senses encompassing! Only complaint is the need to "cook" the food you find, for it to effectively recharge your life. Errgh. :)
customer_reviews.author: Molly Granger

customer_reviews.title: Order it. You'll regret if you don't. Crazily good!
customer_reviews.text: Best game ever. I do mean that. My first gaming unit was an Atari. If I had invested all the money I sunk into games since then I would have been retired by 40! Open world, side quests, great character development. it's got it all!
customer_reviews.author: OKintheStix

customer_reviews.title: Gift for Grandkids
customer_reviews.text: This game is a hit. The grandkids are loving their game time with Zelda, and even the youngest is learning how to read
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Fogle

customer_reviews.title: Possibly the greatest game I've played
customer_reviews.text: This game is absolutely incredible. I'm 20 hours into it, and it's already possibly the greatest video game I've ever played in my life, and I've been a life long gamer. It's just perfect all around. It's hard to believe how good it is. All the positive hype about this game is very real. It's a must play for any gamer.
customer_reviews.author: aktvst

customer_reviews.title: Zelda Breath of the You Climb on Everything and It's Great
customer_reviews.text: This is the biggest Zelda game ever in terms of exploration. By exploration I mean you will be climbing on things ALL THE TIME. You climb on mountains, hills, ruins, towers, flagpoles, buildings, internal cave structures, various rooms and Divine Beasts. It can be difficult to defeat powerful enemies early on but sometimes you can just dump bombs on Bokoblin camps until everything is ash. Upgrade your bombs as soon as you can.
customer_reviews.author: skellington

customer_reviews.title: Shocker: The Cake is also a lie!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible storyline. You don't even get to play with Zelda...who knew? You just run around as this cryogenic old (yet still young looking) male figure named Link. There should really be a disclaimer on the package. The name of the game is Zelda. I feel so misled.
customer_reviews.author: {Nie}

customer_reviews.title: we have great conversations about the puzzles
customer_reviews.text: A game changer for open world games. My PlayStation 4 is not the console that is collecting dust. And because my son is also playing this game, we have great conversations about the puzzles, exploration and systems of the game. Definitely on my top 10 games of all time, just have to decide which of my previous 10 is going to get the 11th spot
customer_reviews.author: Ferbdog

customer_reviews.title: Great game even for non-zelda fans
customer_reviews.text: I decided to order the game a few weeks after release after seeing all of the great reviews and fan feedback. It took Amazon a while to get a copy since this is a hot item. I haven't played a Zelda game since SNES, so this is a pretty big step for me as a gamer. This game is a masterpiece though and any gamer of all backgrounds should give it a shot. I'm very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Clay

customer_reviews.title: The Game to Own & Play
customer_reviews.text: This game made my WiiU worth owning after years, the console has gotten more play time in the last week than since I bought it! A wonderful game full of surprises, exploration, fantastic characters, a great story... and it's FUN. 10/10
customer_reviews.author: W. R. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Best Zelda game ever
customer_reviews.text: Best Zelda game ever - not a perfect game, some very annoying parts in fact; but I cant put it down. Probably my game of the year - lots of good competition this year though. You feel very powerless at beginning, no stamina and weapons breaking -- by the end you are sending Guardian's eye-beams back with a well timed shield parry and you feel great!
customer_reviews.author: squidracerX

customer_reviews.title: GREAT GREAT GREAT
customer_reviews.text: This game has won so many awards and its well deserved. It completely embodies everything RIGHT with video games. The vast open world, learning how to do things on your own without excessive hand holding. the story was a typical zelda story, but it was still enjoyable. There's not much else i can say except this is probably one of the best games out there.
customer_reviews.author: Valdrake

customer_reviews.title: Stunning Adventure
customer_reviews.text: Pros: The bar really has been raised on this one. Between the graphics, the thought that went into even the smallest details, and the remarkable amount of freedom and exploration, this game is truly amazing. Cons: I want my husband back. Only 92 more koroks to go...
customer_reviews.author: niicoollaa

customer_reviews.title: TERRIFIC MASTERPIECE! I LOVE how Zelda has grown through ...
customer_reviews.text: TERRIFIC MASTERPIECE! I LOVE how Zelda has grown through the years and this title does live up to its name. An ever enchanting, wonderful work of art that makes you feel you are truly breathing the Zelda world every step you take. It has been a while since I enjoyed a Zelda game so much as I enjoyed this (since Twilight Princess, exactly). If you love Zelda games, please, you should NOT miss this one out. You'll definitely not regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas Manfredi

customer_reviews.title: Wow fantastic game. So much fun and adventure
customer_reviews.text: Wow fantastic game. So much fun and adventure. They took out the interface with the game pad, which is a disappointment... but this game is so good it does not matter. I think it would have been even better if they used the game pad, so sad to see Nintendo give up on the best product they ever made ... the WIIU and this game tops all wiiu games.
customer_reviews.author: Styx_Ray

customer_reviews.title: Epic a modern classic
customer_reviews.text: Just as epic as I hoped. Wonderful graphics, simple controls. Music, world, and combat system are amazing. Definitely a must for all gamers with a Wii U or Switch. Does have frame work issues but not as bad as some gamers claimed.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany S.

customer_reviews.title: So so good.
customer_reviews.text: Easily the best Zelda game so far, IMO. A little Skyrim, a little Dark Souls, a little Assassins Creed, and a lot of Zelda. The world is huge with endless approaches with tons of exploring to do. Good mix of puzzle and RPG adventures. Environmental effects are fantastic. This could easily be the Game of the Year.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: The best video game you will ever play
customer_reviews.text: I blame this game for all my sleepless nights. It's an open world, so you can literally do so many things. I've beaten the game twice and still go back to complete new side quests. There is so much to do, it will be impossible for you to put the controller down.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Best Zelda Ever
customer_reviews.text: I bought this game not knowing what to expect. At first, I didn't really like it. However, the more I played, the more I liked it. And I can probably say now, this is my best game of all time. It is pretty much a mix of Assassins Creed, Skyrim, Dark Souls, and Ocarina of Time! Don't wanna give any spoilers, but this game is awesome. Happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mohsin

customer_reviews.title: A Breath of fresh air.
customer_reviews.text: A never perfectly executed adventure on a monstrously large scale. This is currently my favorite game. There are tons of things to do, a really good battle system and as the game progresses your really do begin to feel more like the Hero than any other Zelda game before it! Zelda Breath of the Wild is simply breathtaking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Zelda title yet!
customer_reviews.text: The world is completely open. No impenetrable forest. There are rivers to forge, mountains to climb, animals and vegetables to harvest and eat. Tons of recognizable foes with some new twists. Truly an epic adventure for a Zelda fan since the first NES.
customer_reviews.author: B. Stucki

customer_reviews.title: Paid for new. Got used.
customer_reviews.text: Item was described as new. It was not. Came unsealed and no book. Nothing like giving a kid a used item for a gift. 🤬
customer_reviews.author: cathi guy

customer_reviews.title: Game is overrated..
customer_reviews.text: So many nice reviews and thrills about the game but my kid didn't really like it.
customer_reviews.author: Rahil Vora

customer_reviews.title: Super fun so far
customer_reviews.text: Super fun so far. So many things to explore, so many amazing breathtaking views. Link is more like a real person in this game. You have to hunt, gather, cook, eat, make fire and defend yourself from all the Bokoblins and Gannon's demons by finding weapons. Graphics make you feel like you are outside on the great plateau and the ambient sounds are very realistic. Controls take some getting use to as with any new game but are very organic feeling. You can use the Game Pad or Pro Controller only. Game Pad works best because of motion controls.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Vanderburg

customer_reviews.title: One of the best video games I've ever played
customer_reviews.text: One of the best video games I've ever played. It's been critically praised and for good reason, it's an incredible experience - and that's coming from someone who has no nostalgia for Zelda. The framerate leaves something to be desired, though, and the Wii U version might be even slightly worse, so if you're not willing to deal with drops in very particular areas, especially towns, you might want to invest in a Switch if this game is a must for you. I have heard the framerate is greatly improved when playing handhold mold, though.
customer_reviews.author: E. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great Game
customer_reviews.text: Hours of fun for older and younger gamers alike. Immersive world. Lighthearted and easy, great for a change from more adult games. Very well done
customer_reviews.author: jacob

customer_reviews.title: Best Zelda Game Yet
customer_reviews.text: Nintendo hit it out of the park with this one. Huge world with lots to explore. Interesting variety of enemies that expand as you find your way out to new areas. Lots of to do. Should keep you occupied for months if you only can play several hours a day. Sad the Wii U is dead, but at least Nintendo went out with a bang.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe

customer_reviews.title: A New Zelda Game Takes the Open-World Genre to a Whole New Level
customer_reviews.text: Breath of the Wild is Nintendo's last published-game for the Wii U (despite with the discontinuation of the console), and it's consider to be the best Zelda game of all time. Amazing graphics, very deep emotional story, awesome controls, good combat, and hours and hours of exciting adventure! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: My wife and I love playing this game together
customer_reviews.text: I had really high expectations of this game. All exceeded. My wife and I love playing this game together. Great puzzles. Mini-games are okay. Open world feeling of just exploring and killin' bad guys/wild animals. I miss a good gambling game like Thrill Digger from Skyward but over all a nearly perfect beautiful game.
customer_reviews.author: Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: You just have to experience it.
customer_reviews.text: Playing this game makes me feel like I'm going on an epic quest. Unlike other video games I've played where it's all about the destination, I love that this one is purely about the journey to get there. It's tough to describe. It's something you just have to experience.
customer_reviews.author: rubberducky

customer_reviews.title: Great Fun!
customer_reviews.text: I hesitated to purchase this because I thought, incorrectly, that the game would have a noticeably lower resolution than that of the Switch, owned by my daughter and her family. In reality, it's fine and my grandson loves playing it when he visits my house. Great graphics!
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: A promising and majestic game.
customer_reviews.text: Zelda games are always amazing. Nintendo doesn't let down on an auspiciously enchanting experience. Emprise yourself on an immersive adventure that will take a plethora of your free time. Definitely a game to commit to playing for hours on end.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Daughter loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Sure it's old now but retro games are in. This is her favorite of the Wii Zeldas. Sorry I can't say much more cause it's my 12 year daughter who plays it, not me. Hope this helps. Cheers!
customer_reviews.author: Stianazon

customer_reviews.title: Best game ever
customer_reviews.text: Best game ever. If you are a Zelda fan you will not be disappointed with this game. It is everything we had hoped for and then some. The long wait was worth it. Fantastic game.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the hubs and turns out our 5 year old loves it too. My hubby keeps saying, "wish I could call in sick tomorrow so I can stay up all night playing Zelda and drinking Mtn Dew." Those gaming days, well nights, are very few and far between these days. Kids, work, responsibilities...being a grown up isn't always fun.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Most boring, tedious, repetitive game
customer_reviews.text: I love zelda games but I actually fell asleep while playing this game. I do not understand how it has almost a perfect 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Nique

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to the Zelda franchise
customer_reviews.text: Great gameplay. There's so much to do - you will spend days exploring all of Hyrule. It also suits all types of gameplay, stealth, or just jumping into the fray, as you like it. Also the puzzles are fun, especially the Korok seeds. Love the cooking mechanics, it gives an additional impetus to traveling and collecting. The Great Fairy enhancements do feel a little like sexual assault though.
customer_reviews.author: wizzard

product_meta.title: The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild - Wii U
product_meta.description:
Platform:Nintendo Wii U| Edition:Standard

Step into a world of discovery, exploration, and adventure in The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild, a boundary-breaking new game in the acclaimed series. Travel across vast fields, through forests, and to mountain peaks as you discover what has become of the kingdom of Hyrule in this stunning Open-Air Adventure. Now on the Nintendo Switch console, your journey is freer and more open than ever. Take your system anywhere, and adventure as Link any way you like.

 * Discover a world as never before seen: by making your own path, choices, and consequences 
 * Ingenuity is the key to survival: find multiple solutions to tons of dynamic puzzles 
 * Surprises hide around every corner: scavenge weapons, armor, plants, animals, and more 
 * Live off the land: find weapons and armor, cook food, and brew elixirs 
 * Utilize special technology: the in-game Sheikah Slate controls objects and enemies in fun ways 
 * Gear up: many weapons and armor have unique stats, resistances, effects, and durability 
 * Shrines offer hundreds of clever challenges even veterans won’t see coming 
 * Compatible amiibo include the Wolf Link amiibo figure, figures from the Legend of Zelda 30th Anniversary amiibo series, and figures from The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild amiibo series. Each one will offer Link in-game items that may just come in handy.Battery: no battery used
feature_bullets: Explore the wilds of Hyrule any way you like Climb up towers and mountain peaks in search of new destinations, then set your own path to get there and plunge into the wilderness. Along the way, you'll battle towering enemies, hunt wild beasts and gather ingredients for the food and elixirs you'll need to sustain you on your journey

More than 100 Shrines of Trials to discover and explore Shrines dot the landscape, waiting to be discovered in any order you want. Search for them in various ways, and solve a variety of puzzles inside. Work your way through the traps and devices inside to earn special items and other rewards that will help you on your adventure

Be prepared and properly equipped With an entire world waiting to be explored, you'll need a variety of outfits and gear to reach every corner. You may need to bundle up with warmer clothes or change into something better suited to the desert heat. Some clothing even has special effects that, for example, can make you faster and stealthier

Battling enemies requires strategy The world is inhabited with enemies of all shapes and sizes. Each one has its own attack method and weaponry, so you must think quickly and develop the right strategies to defeat them

amiibo compatibility Tap the Wolf Link amiibo (sold separately) to make Wolf Link appear in game. Wolf Link will attack enemies on his own and help you find items you're searching for. We will also introduce new The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild series of amiibo at E3 this year

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars2,330 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
specifications.Pricing: The strikethrough price is the List Price. Savings represents a discount off the List Price.
